channel.title: Help deobbing RSPS client jarfiles
channel.description:
So. I've recently discovered reflection and would like to utilize it. Problem is, all the servers worth creating reflection libraries for have their client jarfiles obfuscated.
I require help in deobfuscating these.
I'll have you all know I'm a beginner at Java. I would like to actually learn how to do this, but I'd also like to actually get it done in a reasonable amount of time. A mix of results and learning would be great.
I've attempted on my own but failed.
Basically, I want to turn this [img]http://puu.sh/3dAIn.png[/img] into this [img]http://puu.sh/3dAL8.png[/img]. I need to get the original client classfiles. I hear there's a lot of manual renaming, whatever that means?
If anyone could assist me in doing this, I'd be very appreciative.
Thanks.

item.title: Help deobbing RSPS client jarfiles
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

So. I’ve recently discovered reflection and would like to utilize it. Problem is, all the servers worth creating reflection libraries for have their client jarfiles obfuscated.

I require help in deobfuscating these.

I’ll have you all know I’m a beginner at Java. I would like to actually learn how to do this, but I’d also like to actually get it done in a reasonable amount of time. A mix of results and learning would be great.
